brrp.configScreen.dump.tooltip: Dump this runtime resource pack as local files, so as to view its content like regular resource packs and server data in the file manager.
brrp.configScreen.nothing: No resource packs of this type.
brrp.configScreen.regenerate.notSupporte: This runtime resource pack does not support regenerating.
brrp.configScreen.regenerate.tooltip: Regenerate the content of this runtime resource pack, mainly intended for debugging. In the development environment, you may regenerate data after applying hot-swap, and then press F3+T or type /data command to load the regenerated client resource or server data.
brrp.configScreen.tab.description: %s for tab page %s out of %s. Activate the button to switch to the tab page.
brrp.configScreen.tab.narration: Currently tab page %s out of %s. Activate tab page buttons or press Ctrl+Tab to switch another tab page.
brrp.configScreen.title: Configuration of Runtime Resource Packs
brrp.dumpScreen.dumpPath.title: Dump to following path:
brrp.dumpScreen.dumpPath.tooltip: Enter the path to be dumped in. The folder will be created if it does not exist, and existing files in it will be removed before dumping.
brrp.dumpScreen.dumpToPath:
Will be dumped to following path:
%s
brrp.dumpScreen.dumpType.tooltip.all: Dump all resources, including client resources and server data
brrp.dumpScreen.existing.message:
The dump path has %1$s existing files. Please confirm the dump path:
%2$s
If you dump, the %1$s existing files will be removed.
brrp.dumpScreen.existing.title: Are you sure to dump at this path?
brrp.dumpScreen.title: Dump resource pack: %s
brrp.pack.empty.name: Empty Pack
brrp.pack.test.description: The runtime resource pack for testing in the development environment, providing basic assets and data for test blocks and items in the development environment. In non-development environment, the resource pack as well as relative blocks and items will not be generated.
brrp.pack.test.name: Test Pack (Before Vanilla)
brrp.pack.test_before_user.description: The runtime resource in the development environment registered in the event before user. It can be enabled or disabled in the vanilla "Resource Packs" options, or via "data" command when in worlds. The pack modifies the look and loot table of yellow wool.
brrp.pack.test_before_user.name: Test Pack (Before User)
brrp.regenerateScreen.interrupt.tooltip: Interrupt the resource generation process. §c§lIt may cause incompatibility of the resource pack.§r
brrp.regenerateScreen.state.idle: Click one of the buttons to regenerate resources. If some buttons are disabled, the pack may not support it.
brrp.regenerateScreen.title: Regenerate resources: %s
modmenu.descriptionTranslation.brrp_v1: BRRP is a library mod that can generate resource packs at runtime, instead of storing them as files. The mod is based on Advanced Runtime Resource Pack mod.
modmenu.summaryTranslation.brrp_v1: Library mod to generate resource packs at runtime.
